node.title: Texts From Virgil
node.alt: Virgil Abloh, with phone in hand, before his fall 2020 Off-White show in Paris.
node.description: After his death, Virgil Abloh’s friends and colleagues shared some of the kind, curious and relentlessly optimistic DMs the designer was known to send. “2021 is a picture for us all to urgently paint.”
node.content: ["To Virgil Abloh, Instagram was the equivalent of a creative directory, something he\u2019d scroll through to find collaborators and keep up with friends\u2019 careers. \u201cIf someone has the right personality, I direct message them and ask them to work on projects for me,\u201d he said in 2019.", "For those on the receiving end of Mr. Abloh\u2019s energetic DMs, his messages now serve as mementos, encapsulating the spirit of who he was in their lives. Following the announcement of the designer\u2019s death on Sunday, many of his friends, colleagues and mentees used social media to proudly, somberly share screenshots of their exchanges with Mr. Abloh \u2014 ranging from mundane to profound.", "The DMs \u201creflect the character and responsibility Virgil took on to lead a global community,\u201d said Samuel Ross, a British designer and one of Mr. Abloh\u2019s mentees. \u201cAlongside the top-line perspective he held, he was able to still make time for the important micros of life.\u201d"]
